name: Oaks on Market

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was modern and very clean. Great location and at A$135 per night through Wotif, it was excellent value for such a big city.
reviews.title: Great value and location

likes.disliked: — Shower pressure was a bit low

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely stay there again, especially at those rates !
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.text: We have just returned from three nights at the Oaks . The check in was friendly and efficient,and we received a requested high room with a stunning view over Melbourne. The studio apartment was well appointed, and quite roomy-included a small table and a couch,and small kitchen.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were included in the rate and while basic, were more than adequate. We had one evening meal in the restaurant which was of a high quality and well priced.
reviews.title: Fantastic !!

likes.liked: — The cleanliness and the size of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Oaks is well situated to the Collins street theatres(we saw the stage show Wicked which was excellent) ,to the Casino and Eureka Tower, and to the Southern Cross Coach and Railway Station.A stop on the free Circle line tram is 100m away.The location is central and quiet
reviews.title: clean and modern

likes.disliked: — shower - difficult to maintain heat, seemed temperamental! Too hot at night. A little out of the centre of the city.

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the location! The rooms are also very large and quite nicely decorated. I'd recommend eating out over the restaurant, which was quite average.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Normally the rooms are clean but last time i stayed here it looked as though the bathroom had hardly been cleaned (hairs in the shower, tissues and rubbish in the toilet bin). Not nice
reviews.title: A Safe Bet....

likes.liked: — Great Location and Value for Money

reviews.text: The Oaks on Market is a safe bet if you are looking for a 3 star hotel in the Melbourne CBD.
reviews.title: Curtain divided bedroom! But centrally located and convenient

likes.disliked: — Not very private in the 2 bedrooms

reviews.text: There are two Oaks properties in Melbourne. They are both within 300 metres of each other. Avoid the Oaks on Collins like the plague but the Oaks on Market is much better.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Oaks on Market

reviews.text: The rooms are quite modern. They are well set out, clean and comfortable. The location is very good just off Collins Street and in very easy walking distance of the city centre, Southbank and Southern Cross or Flinders Street Rail Station. You are within 100 metres of a tram stop on both Collins & Flinders Lane also.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We booked for 8 nights and would think we would get a decent room. It took two days to move us from a room that was an exact U shape around the lift shaft, with three lifts going up and down all night. We thankfully had ear plugs, but you could still hear the noise. How can a hotel build rooms the wrap around a lift shaft.
reviews.title: shocking

reviews.text: The service was terrible, half the members of the reception do not speak very good English, and even though we were told we were going to be moved, when we enquired later, there was not one staff member who knew anything about it. We also clearly instructed them to accept a very imp Fedex package to which they rejected it, even though it was clearly addressed to us.
reviews.title: Oaks on Market Street was a Great Choice!

likes.liked: — The location, and the spacious apartment

reviews.text: The rooms are cheap office conversions, and very basic. Towel rail fell off the wall, walls were filthy dirty, with marks on light switches, and walls that had not been cleaned off from previous guest, imagine all the germs,. Also I did not appreciate having free to air pornography in the bedroom either, how disgusting, imagine if children came across that. How can they get away with that.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: We will NEVER stay there again.
reviews.title: Well worth staying here

likes.liked: — value, close to attractions & transport, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Oaks on Market Street for three days, and was very impressed with the room and the location.
reviews.title: Good Value For Money, But Don't Expect 5 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On request of a room with a view we arrived to be treated to a fantastic corner room on level 16 with uninterrupted views of the Yarra river over to Crown Casino. We found the room to be spacious with a handy kitchenette and flat screen TV (though the remote was well worn and had to be wrestled with to get it to work), housekeeping immaculate each day, and great pool/spa/sauna/gym in the basement. Negatives were a king bed made from two king singles & above mentioned TV issue. A shame they didn't install a bath that an adult could fit into considering the amount of room available to do so in the bathroom. The hotel itself was fresh, clean, and modern. Location was excellent with just a short stroll to either southbank or the CBD. The free city circle tram was located just a short walk away. The restaurant downstairs looked ok, but due to the range of choices in the city we didn't end of eating there. Overall I would highly recommend due to the location, availability of pool/spa/sauna/gym, and the reasonable rate obtained from their website.
reviews.title: Great option for the price!

likes.disliked: — Two king singles for the bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd always check on tripadvisor before booking a hotel and this was no exception. I was originally interested in Oaks on Lonsdale because it was in the top 3 reviewed hotels in Melbourne however given the location of Oaks on Market and the fact it had a pool, gym and was reviewed well I decided to take a risk and go with it even though not in the top 10.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: I'm pleased to say it did not dissappoint, the room was perfect and very good value for money. Cannot complain about anything really, just a simple room with big flat screen tv, all amenaties required and a great view over the river as requested when I booked.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Would 100% stay again and recommend to others.
reviews.title: Great hotel & location for business/pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tim
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

likes.liked: — The view and the close proximity to the City attractions

description: Oaks on Market is centrally located and newly refurbished Melbourne accommodation, offering easy access to Melbourne’s attractions: shopping, theatres, dining and entertainment, as well as proximity to the legal and financial precincts. Oaks On Market comprises 280 luxuriously appointed Studio, 1 and 2 bedroom fully self-contained apartments. All rooms have brand new 32-inch flat screen TVs, sofas and contemporary artwork. Some rooms have views over the Yarra River and guests can also enjoy individual stereo systems, climate control, access to the indoor heated lap pool, fully equipped gym, spa and sauna.
